Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Mosaic Variegated Aneuploidy Syndrome 1 present clinical features that include severe intellectual disability, dysmorphic features, and a broad spectrum of congenital anomalies. We report a case of a Mosaic Variegated Aneuploidy Syndrome 1 patient with a de novo mutation in the NIPBL gene. The patient presented with severe intellectual disability, dysmorphic features,. Some special cases also present with congenital anomalies. The clinical features of Mosaic Variegated Aneuploidy Syndrome 1 patients are variable and can be difficult to diagnose. The diagnosis of Mosaic Variegated Aneuploidy Syndrome 1 is based on the presence of mosaic aneuploidy and a characteristic clinical phenotype.
